labels.analysis: The MCP Server "R2 Gen" is primarily focused on image generation with a specific architecture using Cloudflare Workers and R2 storage. It offers asynchronous image generation, real-time status updates, and a type-safe API for reliable image creation. The core functionality revolves around generating images with seamless integration between Cloudflare's R2 storage and Replicate (a service for running machine learning models). This aligns closely with AI/ML tools for content generation.
labels.reasoning: The server's primary functionality is image generation using AI/ML models, which fits squarely into the "AI/ML Tools" category. The use of Cloudflare Workers and R2 storage for handling image data suggests additional relevance to "Cloud Services." No other predefined categories capture the unique combination of features (e.g., Replicate integration, R2 storage, async image generation).

server_info_crawled.name: R2 Gen
server_info_crawled.author: @agan2023416/workers
server_info_crawled.overview:
An MCP server for image generation, utilizing Cloudflare Workers to store images in R2.

Seamless integration with replicate-2-r2 worker
Asynchronous image generation support
Real-time status feedback
Type-safe API calls
Comprehensive error handling
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@agan2023416/workers/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: workerApiToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: API token for authenticating with the Cloudflare Worker
